translation.en: He knew very well that in their eyes, the role of the disappointed lover of a maiden or of any single woman might be ridiculous; but the role of a man who was pursuing a married woman, and who made it the purpose of his life at all cost to draw her into adultery, was one which had in it something beautiful and dignified and could never be ridiculous; so it was with a proud, glad smile lurking under his moustache that he put down the opera-glasses and looked at his cousin.

translation.ru: Ему казалось, что при нормальном развитии богатства в государстве все эти явления наступают, только когда на земледелие положен уже значительный труд, когда оно стало в правильные, по крайней мере в определенные условия; что богатство страны должно расти равномерно и в особенности так, чтобы другие отрасли богатства не опережали земледелия; что сообразно с известным состоянием земледелия должны быть соответствующие ему и пути сообщения, и что при нашем неправильном пользовании землей железные дороги, вызванные не экономическою, но политическою необходимостью, были преждевременны и, вместо содействия земледелию, которого ожидали от них, опередив земледелие и вызвав развитие промышленности и кредита, остановили его, и что потому, так же как одностороннее и преждевременное развитие органа в животном помешало бы его общему развитию, так для общего развития богатства в России кредит, пути сообщения, усиление фабричной деятельности, несомненно необходимые в Европе, где они своевременны, у нас только сделали вред, отстранив главный очередной вопрос устройсгва земледелия.
translation.en: It seemed to him that when the growth of a nation's wealth is normal these things follow only after a considerable amount of labour has been devoted to agriculture, and after the latter has been placed in its rightful – or at any rate in a definite – position: that a nation's wealth ought to grow proportionately at the same rate in all its branches, and especially in such a way that the other branches should not out-distance agriculture; that means of communication should conform to the agricultural conditions, and that with our wrong methods of using the land, the railways – brought about not by economic but by political necessity – had come prematurely, and instead of promoting agriculture as had been expected, had interfered with it and hindered it by stimulating the development of manufactures and credit. Therefore, as the one-sided and premature development of a single organ in an animal would injure its general development, so credit, railways, and the forced growth of manufactures, though undoubtedly necessary in Europe, where the time is ripe for them – had in Russia only harmed the general development of wealth by thrusting aside the most important current question, namely, the organization of agriculture.

Все было красиво, как хорошенький пейзаж, только что оконченный и покрытый лаком.
translation.en: All that he saw from the carriage window through the cold pure air in the pale light of the evening sky seemed as fresh, bright and vigorous as he was himself. The roofs of the houses glittered in the evening sun; the sharp outlines of the fences and corners of buildings, the figures of people and vehicles they occasionally met, the motionless verdure of the grass and trees, the fields of potatoes with their clear-cut ridge, the slanting shadows of the houses and trees, the bushes and even the potato ridges – it was all pleasant and like a landscape newly painted and varnished.

translation.en: In this way he lived, not knowing or seeing any possibility of knowing what he was or why he lived in the world, and he suffered so much from that ignorance that he was afraid he might commit suicide, while at the same time he was firmly cutting his own particular definite path through life.

translation.en: His brother, his wife, and the unknown visitor appeared in a different light to him now.

translation.ru: -- Во-первых, я его ничего не просил передавать тебе, во-вторых, я никогда не говорю неправды. А главное, я хотел остаться и остался, -- сказал он хмурясь. -- Анна, зачем, зачем? -- сказал он после минуты молчания, перегибаясь к ней, и открыл руку, надеясь, что она положит в нее свою.
translation.en: 'For one thing, I did not give him any message for you; and for another I never say what is not true. But chiefly, I wanted to stay, so I stayed,' he replied with a frown. 'Anna! Why? Why?...' he asked after a short pause, bending toward her and opening his hand, hoping that she would place hers in it.

translation.en: Both in the large and small halls the noblemen were grouped together in their parties, and from the hostility and suspicion of their glances, from the cessation of their conversations when a stranger approached, and from the fact that some of them even went whispering into the farther corridor, it was evident that each party had secrets it kept from the other.

translation.en: It seemed to Dolly that Anna was not at ease in her mind, but in a state of anxiety that Dolly knew well from her own experience, a state which does not come on without a cause, but generally hides dissatisfaction with oneself.

translation.en: When she saw the invalid she pitied him, and that pity produced in her woman's soul not the horror and repulsion which it evoked in her husband but a need for action, for finding out all the particulars of his condition, and a desire to help him.

translation.en: WHEN LEVIN THOUGHT about what he was and why he lived, he could find no answer and was driven to despair; but when he left off asking himself those questions he seemed to know what he was and why he lived, for he acted and lived unfalteringly and definitely – recently even more unfalteringly than before.

translation.en: 'Well, will you believe it? I have got so out of the habit that it makes me feel ashamed.

translation.en: 'Yes, that is the very best way,' he said, chewing some cheese and filling the glass with a special kind of vodka. And the conversation was really ended by the joke.

translation.ru: -- Очень.
translation.en: 'Quite.

translation.en: 'All I know is that I never saw better brought up children than yours,' said Levin, 'and do not wish for better children.'

translation.ru: Я давно вам говорю, -- обратился он к Лизе Меркаловой, -- что для того, чтобы не было скучно, надо не думать, что будет скучно. Это все равно, как не надо бояться, что не заснешь, если боишься бессонницы.
translation.en: 'That is the best way. I have always told you,' he went on, turning to Lisa Merkalova, 'that if one wishes not to be bored one must not expect to be bored, just as one must not be afraid of not falling asleep if one wishes to avoid sleeplessness.

translation.ru: -- Вам кого надо? -- спросил он.
translation.en: 'Whom do you want?' he asked.

translation.en: And you?' asked Yashvin, looking at Vronsky with half-closed eyes and evidently divining that there had been a quarrel.

translation.ru: Только когда он подошел к ее голове, она вдруг затихла, и мускулы ее затряслись под тонкою, нежною шерстью.
translation.en: Only when he reached to her head did she suddenly calm down, and the muscles under her fine, delicate coat vibrated.

translation.en: She said it so that the latter could hear, with an evident desire that he should do so. 'And how handsome, how nobly handsome!...

translation.ru: Он жалел и сына больше, чем прежде, и упрекал себя теперь за то, что слишком мало занимался им.
translation.en: He pitied his son too, more than he had done before, and reproached himself for not having paid more attention to him.

translation.ru: Мы должны говорить и помогать друг другу.
translation.en: We must speak, and so help one another.'

translation.en: 'What is the difficulty?' asked Levin.

translation.en: 'Why not?' irritably answered Nicholas, still addressing Kritsky.

translation.ru: -- Да почему же ты думаешь?
translation.en: 'But why do you suppose such a thing?'

translation.en: 'Because everybody knows it.'

translation.en: 'Yes, as soon as I returned home I put on a black coat,' Vronsky replied with a smile, slowly taking out his opera-glasses.

translation.ru: -- Я понимаю, -- сказала Дарья Александровна, невольно любуясь им, как он искренно и твердо сказал это. -- Но именно потому, что вы себя чувствуете причиной, вы преувеличиваете, я боюсь, -- сказала она. -- Положение ее тяжело в свете, я понимаю.
translation.en: 'I understand,' said Dolly, involuntarily admiring him for the frank and firm way in which he said it. 'But just because you feel you have caused it, I'm afraid you exaggerate it,' she said. 'I understand that her position in Society is a hard one.'

translation.ru: Никакого сюрприза тоже не было.
translation.en: It has not been a surprise either.

translation.ru: -- Вот, мама, -- сказала Кити матери, -- вы удивляетесь, что я восхищаюсь ею.
translation.en: 'There, Mama,' said Kitty. 'And you are surprised that I admire her.'

translation.ru: Он-то был главным виновником холода, заморозившего всех гостей до приезда Степана Аркадьича.
translation.en: He was the chief cause of the iciness which had frozen all the visitors till Oblonsky's arrival.

translation.ru: Это определенно выраженное намерение удивило Левина. Но так как ему было все равно, он тотчас же попросил Степана Аркадьича, как будто это была его обязанность, ехать в деревню и устроить там все, что он знает, с тем вкусом, которого у него так много.
translation.en: This decided expression of her wish surprised Levin, but, as it was quite immaterial to him, he at once begged Oblonsky to go to the house in the country, just as if it were Oblonsky's duty to go, and arrange everything there according to his own good taste.

translation.ru: Она помнила только том, что ей нынче нужно еще зайти к m-me Вerthe и поспеть домой к чаю maman, к двенадцати часам.
translation.en: She only knew that she had to call on Madame Berthe and get home in time for Mama's midnight tea.

translation.ru: Ты знаешь, Долли давно этого желала. И Львов был же у нее и бывает.
translation.en: 'Do you know, Dolly has long wished it: and Lvov called on her and goes to see her.

translation.ru: XXVI
translation.en: CHAPTER XXVI

translation.en: 'Sit down! I must speak to you,' he said, taking the letter-case under his arm and pressing it so tight with his elbow that his shoulder went up.

translation.en: The soup, Marie Louise, had succeeded to perfection, the tiny pasties melted in one's mouth and were flawless.

translation.en: Of course Kostya and Kitty are so considerate that we don't feel it; but it can't go on so.

translation.en: 'Oh no! I am sorry for you.'

translation.en: 'Did you have a good night?' he inquired, bowing toward them both, and leaving it to Karenin to take the greeting as meant for himself and to recognize him, or not, as he pleased.

translation.ru: Алексей Александрович слушал ее теперь, и те выражения, которые прежде не то что были неприятны ему, а казались излишними, теперь показались естественны и утешительны.
translation.en: Karenin listened to her now, and those very expressions, which formerly had seemed to him if not disagreeable at least superfluous, now seemed natural and comforting.

translation.ru: При такой любви не может быть никакой драмы.
translation.en: For such love there can be no tragedy.

translation.ru: Он не верил ни в чох, ни в смерть, но был очень озабочен вопросом улучшения быта духовенства и сокращения приходов, причем особенно хлопотал, чтобы церковь осталась в его селе.
translation.en: He believed in neither God nor Devil, yet he was much concerned by the question of improving the condition of the clergy and limiting parishes, and was at the same time particularly active in seeing that the church should be retained in his village.

translation.ru: Он старался не развлекаться и не портить себе впечатления, глядя на махание руками белогалстучного капельмейстера, всегда так неприятно развлекающее музыкальное внимание, на дам в шляпах, старательно для концерта завязавших себе уши лентами, и на все эти лица, или ничем не занятые, или занятые самыми разнообразными интересами, но только не музыкой.
translation.en: He tried not to let his mind wander nor to let his impression of the music be marred by looking at the white-tied conductor's arm-waving, which always so unpleasantly distracts one's attention from the music; nor by the ladies with their bonnets, the ribbons of which were so carefully tied over their ears for the concert, nor by all those other persons who were either not interested in anything or were interested in all sorts of things other than music.

translation.ru: После разговора своего с Алексеем Александровичем Вронский вышел на крыльцо дома Карениных и остановился, с трудом вспоминая, где он и куда ему надо ндти или ехать.
translation.en: AFTER HIS CONVERSATION with Karenin Vronsky went out on to the Karenins' porch and then stopped, recalling with difficulty where he was and where he ought to go.

translation.ru: Одни мылись, молодые ребята купались в реке, другие прилаживали место для отдыха, развязывали мешочки с хлебом и оттыкали кувшинчики с квасом.
translation.en: Some had a wash. The young lads bathed in the river; others arranged places for their after-dinner rest, unfastened their bags of bread and unstoppered their jugs of kvas.

translation.en: Sergius Ivanich quite regards it as Kostya's duty to act as his steward, and so does his sister.

translation.en: She could not think of or desire anything but life with this man; but, as that life had not yet begun, she could not even clearly picture it to herself.

translation.en: Wait – listen!' she implored with a look of pained commiseration. 'What can you be thinking of, since men do not exist for me?

translation.en: Having explained that he could not be there at the beginning of the performance, he promised to come for the last act, and take her to supper.

translation.en: No, I shall not give in to that again!

translation.en: 'You wished to go to see the Princess Oblonskaya,' said the maid, apparently understanding her.

translation.en: 'Lord, pardon and help us!' he kept repeating incessantly to himself, appealing to God, in spite of a long period of apparently complete estrangement, just as trustingly and simply as in the days of childhood and early youth.

translation.en: So he learnt, from Kapitonich, from his nurse, from Nadenka, and from Vasily Lukich, but not from his teachers.

translation.en: Papa is staying with us.

translation.en: 'Perhaps it is because I am glad of what I get, and don't grieve about what I haven't,' said Levin, thinking of Kitty.

translation.en: 'Never, Mama, never at all,' answered Kitty blushing as she looked her mother straight in the face. 'But I have nothing to say at present... I... I... if I wished to, I should not know what to say or how... I don't know...'

translation.en: 'Please come, Constantine Dmitrich!' said he. 'Your brother is looking for you.

translation.en: This thought strongly excited Levin.

translation.en: He lay awake half the night considering the details necessary for carrying his thought into effect.

translation.en: 'Vodka is better than anything,' said Yashvin in his base voice. 'Tereshchenko! Vodka and pickled cucumbers for your master!' he shouted, evidently enjoying the sound of his own voice.

translation.en: 'Wonderful!' said some one else.

translation.en: Do you remember how you used to fly at me for seeking enjoyment in life?

translation.en: He lifted his head and pondered.

translation.en: 'Yes, yes,' he said, 'very likely you are right. But I am glad you are in good spirits and go bear-hunting and work, and are full of enthusiasms, because Shcherbatsky told me he met you and you were down in the mouth, and kept talking about death...'

translation.en: 'Oh, I don't care!' she said.

translation.en: After receiving Extreme Unction the invalid suddenly felt better.

translation.en: More carriages kept driving up, and now ladies with flowers in their hair got out, holding up their trains; or men appeared who doffed their military caps or black hats as they entered the church.

translation.ru: Прежде он чувствовал, что без этого дела жизнь его будет слишком мрачна. Теперь же занятия эти ему были необходимы, чтобы жизнь не была слишком однообразно светла.
translation.en: He used to feel that without it life would be too dismal, and now he needed it in order that his life should not be too monotonously bright.

translation.en: 'We spent three hours together in a railway carriage,' said Levin with a smile, 'but we parted filled with curiosity, as people do after a masquerade, at any rate I did.'

translation.en: 'To-morrow then?

translation.ru: Но что значил счет годов, когда он чувствовал себя молодым душой, каким он был двадцать лет тому назад?
translation.en: And what was the use of counting by years, when he felt as young at heart as he had been twenty years ago?

translation.ru: Давайте не спать всю ночь!
translation.en: Let's not go to bed at all!

translation.en: They had been at the University together, and though they very seldom met, they respected one another and were good friends, and to no one but Slyudin would the doctor have expressed his opinion about his patient.

translation.en: The Princess without replying glanced at Koznyshev.

translation.en: 'What can I do?' said Karenin, shrugging his shoulders and raising his eyebrows.

translation.ru: В конце февраля случилось, что новорожденная дочь Анны, названная тоже Анной, заболела.
translation.en: At the end of February Anna's newborn daughter, also named Anna, happened to fall ill.

translation.ru: Но тотчас же она отвернулась к княгине Марье Борисовне и ни разу не взглянула на него, пока он не встал, прощаясь; тут она посмотрела на него, но, очевидно, только потому, что неучтиво не смотреть на человека, когда он кланяется.
translation.en: But she at once turned to the Princess Mary Borisovna and did not once look round at Vronsky till he rose to go. Then she looked at him, but evidently only because it is impolite not to look at a man when he is bowing to you.

translation.en: 'What do you mean? May I ask how you knew it would waste your time?

translation.en: What was there jolly about it? Do tell me how you manage not to get bored?' said she again to Anna.

translation.en: The mare had broken her back, and it was decided to shoot her.

translation.en: Oblonsky, smelling of wine and cigars, with his face red and happy, came in late, just as she was about to start.

translation.en: With the book under his arm he went upstairs; but to-night, instead of his usual thoughts and calculations about his official affairs, his mind was full of his wife and of something unpleasant that had happened concerning her.

translation.en: 'Oh yes, I do, I do understand, Dolly dear, I do understand,' said Anna, pressing her hand.

translation.ru: Это была сухая, желтая, с черными блестящими глазами, болезненная и нервная женщина.
translation.en: She was a thin, sallow, nervous, ailing woman with shining black eyes.

translation.ru: Связь ее с этим кругом держалась чрез княгиню Бетси Тверскую, жену ее двоюродного брата, у которой было сто двадцать тысяч дохода и которая с самого появления Анны в свет особенно полюбила ее, ухаживала за ней и втягивала в свой круг, смеясь над кругом графини Лидии Ивановны.
translation.en: Anna was connected with this set through the Princess Betsy Tverskaya, the wife of her cousin, who had an income of Rs. 12o,ooo a year, and who, from the time Anna first appeared in Society, had particularly liked her, made much of her, and drawn her into her own set, making fun of that to which the Countess Lydia Ivanova belonged.

translation.ru: Что это такое?
translation.en: What are they?'

translation.ru: Напротив, я вижу какое-то враждебное, ни на чем не основанное отношение общества к этим людям, и мне кажется, что тут зависть...
translation.en: In fact I notice a quite unjustifiable hostility on the part of the public toward these men, and it seems to me that it is envy...'

translation.ru: Что?..
translation.en: What?...

translation.ru: Вронский и Анна тоже что-то говорили тем тихим голосом, которым, отчасти чтобы не оскорбить художника, отчасти чтобы не сказать громко глупость, которую так легко сказать, говоря об искусстве, обыкновенно говорят на выставках картин.
translation.en: Vronsky and Anna were talking in the hushed voice in which – partly not to offend the artist, and partly not to utter aloud a stupid remark such as is so easily made when speaking about art – people generally talk at picture exhibitions.

translation.ru: -- Дурное предзнаменование, -- сказала она.
translation.en: 'It is a bad omen,' she replied.

translation.ru: Жив!
translation.en: Alive!

translation.ru: Тут очень жарко.
translation.en: It is so hot in here.'

translation.ru: Я не делаю и мучаюсь.
translation.en: I don't act and I worry.

translation.ru: Я ждал еще больше...
translation.en: I expected even more.'

translation.ru: -- Но, ради бога, не горячись, -- сказал Степан Аркадьич, дотрагиваясь до коленки зятя. -- Дело не кончено.
translation.en: 'For heaven's sake don't excite yourself,' said Oblonsky, touching his brother-in-law's knee. 'The matter is not closed.

translation.ru: Бессильно опустив руки на одеяло, необычайно прекрасная и тихая, она безмолвно смотрела на него и хотела и не могла улыб-- нуться.
translation.en: With her arms helplessly outstretched upon the quilt, unusually beautiful and calm she lay, gazing silently at him, trying unsuccessfully to smile.

translation.ru: Прежде всего он прошел к скотине.
translation.en: First of all he went to the cattle-yard.

translation.ru: -- Ну, что?-- сказала она; входя в гостиную и не снимая шляпы. -- Вы все веселые.
translation.en: 'Well, how is she?' she said, entering the drawing-room without removing her bonnet.

translation.ru: Ну давай же, братец, суп!..
translation.en: Come, bring us the soup, my good fellow!...

translation.ru: -- Нет, англичанин выкормил на корабле своего ребенка, -- сказал старый князь, позволяя себе эту вольность разговора при своих дочерях.
translation.en: 'Oh yes, an Englishman on board ship did once nurse his baby,' said the old Prince, allowing himself this indelicacy in his daughters' presence.

translation.ru: -- Я и сама думаю, Алексей Александрович.
translation.en: 'I think so too, Alexis Alexandrovich.'

translation.ru: Я не могу простить Вронскому, что он не дал мне знать, когда она была в Петербурге.
translation.en: I can't forgive Vronsky for not letting me know when she was in Petersburg.

translation.ru: Прежде бывало так, что мисс Гуль найдет и покажет ей; но теперь она сама нашла большой березовый шлюпик, и был общий восторженный крик: "Лили нашла шлюпик!"
translation.en: Previously Miss Hull used to find one and point it out to her; but this time Lily herself found a fine big one and there was a general shout of delight: 'Lily has found a mushroom!'

translation.ru: Теперь, когда он держал в руках его письмо, он невольно представлял себе тот вызов, который, вероятно, нынче же или завтра он найдет у себя, и самую дуэль, во время которой он с тем самым холодным и гордым выражением, которое и теперь было на его лице, выстрелив в воздух, будет стоять под выстрелом оскорбленного мужа.
translation.en: Now that he held his letter he could not help imagining to himself the challenge that he would no doubt find waiting for him that evening or next day, and the duel, when he would be standing with the same cold proud look as his face bore that moment, and having fired into the air would be awaiting the shot from the injured husband.

translation.ru: -- Я согласен, но мужественные игры... -- продолжал было он.
translation.en: 'I agree that unmanly sports...' he was continuing.

translation.ru: И все это так неважно.
translation.en: And it is all so unimportant.'

translation.ru: Все ждали, когда он кончит, и он чувствовал это.
translation.en: Everybody waited for him to finish and he was conscious of it.

translation.ru: Ты прав, но я все-таки уеду!
translation.en: You are in the right; but all the same I shall go away.'

translation.ru: Пройдя по широкой чугунной лестнице на площадку, они вошли в первую большую комнату.
translation.en: Ascending the broad cast-iron staircase to the landing, they entered the first large room.

translation.ru: -- Княгиня, пари! -- послышался снизу голос Степана Аркадьича, обращавшегося к Бетси. -- За кого вы держите?
translation.en: 'Princess, a bet!' came the voice of Oblonsky from below, addressing Betsy. 'Whom are you backing?'

translation.ru: Пока седлали лошадь, Левин опять подозвал вертевшегося на виду приказчика, чтобы помириться с ним, и стал говорить ему о предстоящих весенних работах и хозяйственных планах.
translation.en: While the horse was being saddled Levin again called the steward, who was hanging about within sight, in order to make it up with him, and began to talk about the spring work that lay before them and his plans for the estate.

translation.ru: -- Давно, няня, давно? -- поспешно говорила Кити, садясь на стул и приготовляясь к кормлению. -- Да дайте же мне его скорее. Ах, няня, какая вы скучная, ну, после чепчик завяжете!
translation.en: 'Has he been screaming long, Nurse? Long?' she asked hurriedly, sitting down and preparing to nurse the baby. 'Be quick and give him to me! Oh, Nurse! How tiresome you are; come, you can tie up his cap afterwards!'

translation.ru: Собаки вернулись.
translation.en: The dogs returned.

translation.ru: Что тебе, что вам нужно?
translation.en: What is it? What do you want?'

translation.ru: "Избавиться от того, что беспокоит", -- повторяла Анна.
translation.en: 'To escape from his troubles,' Anna mentally repeated.

translation.ru: И в этой простоте и обнаженности она, та самая, которую он любил, была еще виднее.
translation.en: And in this simplicity, this nakedness of soul, she whom he loved was more apparent than ever.

translation.ru: -- Ну, кончил? -- сказал он, встречая наверху Степана Аркадьича. -- Хочешь ужинать?
translation.en: 'Well, have you finished?' he said when he met Oblonsky upstairs. 'Will you have some supper?'

translation.ru: Левин уже привык теперь смело говорить свою мысль, не давая себе труда облекать ее в точные слова; он знал, что жена в такие любовные минуты, как теперь, поймет, что он хочет сказать, с намека, и она поняла его.
translation.en: Levin had by this time become accustomed to express his thoughts boldly, without troubling to put them into precise phraseology; he knew that at such loving moments as the present his wife would understand what he meant from a mere hint, and she did understand him.

translation.ru: -- Что же касается до того, что тебе это не нравится, то, извини меня, -- это наша русская лень и барство, а я уверен, что у тебя это временное заблуждение, и пройдет.
translation.en: 'As to your not liking it, pardon me, but that only comes of our Russian laziness and seigniorial habits, and I am sure that in your case it is a temporary error and will pass.'

translation.en: Even without Vasenka, whom he had blamed for his ill-luck, things went no better. Here, too, were plenty of birds, but Levin missed one after another.

translation.ru: Он ничего не знает и не думает, -- сказал Левин. -- Ты слышал, Михайлыч, об войне? -- обратился он к нему. -- Вот что в церкви читали?
translation.en: He neither knows nor thinks about it,' said Levin. 'Have you heard about the war, Mikhaylich?' he asked, addressing the old man.

translation.ru: На мгновенье буря затихала, но потом опять налетала такими порывами, что, казалось, нельзя было противостоять ей.
translation.en: A momentary lull would be followed by such a terrific gust that it seemed hardly possible to stand against it.

translation.ru: И она, подойдя к кровати, потушила свечу, легла и затихла.
translation.en: She came back to her bed, put out the candle, lay down, and remained quiet.

translation.ru: Барыня дома.
translation.en: The mistress is at home.

translation.ru: С этого вечера началась новая жизнь для Алексея Александровича и для его жены.
translation.en: FROM THAT TIME a new life began for Karenin and his wife.

translation.ru: Лакей этот, Егор, которого прежде не замечал Левин, оказался очень умным и хорошим, а главное, добрым человеком.
translation.en: Egor, the attendant, of whom Levin had taken no notice heretofore, turned out to be a very intelligent, good, and above all very kind man.

translation.ru: Подумайте о ней!
translation.en: Think of her!

translation.ru: Дальнее поле, лежавшее восемь лет в залежах под пусками, было взято с помощью умного плотника Федора Резунова шестью семьями мужиков на новых общественных основаниях, и мужик Шураев снял на тех же условиях все огороды.
translation.en: The far field that had lain fallow for eight years was, with the aid of the intelligent carpenter Theodore Rezunov, taken up by six peasants' families on the new co-operative lines, and the peasant Shuraev rented the vegetable gardens on similar terms.

translation.en: Now that is true.

translation.en: Oblonsky's figure again disappeared behind the bush, and Levin only saw the flare of a match, followed by the red glow of a cigarette and a spiral of blue smoke.

translation.ru: Кити видела каждый день Анну, была влюблена в нее и представляла себе ее непременно в лиловом. Но теперь, увидав ее в черном, она почувствовала, что не понимала всей ее прелести.
translation.en: Kitty had been seeing Anna every day and was in love with her and had always imagined her in lilac, but seeing her in black she felt that she had never before realized her full charm.

translation.ru: -- Хорошо, я пойду непременно, -- сказал Левин, вставая и целуя ее.
translation.en: 'Yes, certainly I will,' said Levin, standing upright and kissing her.

translation.en: Whether or not to apply the Christian principle to his own case was too difficult a question to be lightly discussed, and Karenin had long since answered it in the negative.

translation.ru: -- Ты не любишь мать.
translation.en: 'You don't love your mother!

translation.en: Serezha, with bright eyes and beaming smile, holding his mother with one hand and his nurse with the other, jumped with his plump bare feet on to the carpet.

translation.en: 'Perhaps,' said Vronsky.

translation.en: But on the sixth day, when the coachman returned from the station without him, she felt that she was no longer able to stifle the thought of him and of what he was doing.

translation.en: 'Well, how is one to understand it?

translation.en: And, in spite of his promise to Karenin, he could not refrain from speaking of Anna.

translation.en: Oblonsky repeated these lines with a subtle smile and Levin himself could not help smiling. 'No, but joking apart,' continued Oblonsky, 'just consider.

translation.en: Let us go to the Gipsies! Do you know I have become fond of the gipsies and the Russian folk-songs?'

translation.en: One stands on the same form.

translation.en: He called it having a clean up, or faire la lessive. [Doing the washing.]

translation.ru: "Если я так действую на других, на этого семейного, любящего человека, отчего же он так холоден во мне?.. и не то что холоден, он любит меня, я это знаю. Но что-то новое теперь разделяет нас.
translation.en: 'If I produce such an effect on others, on this married man who loves his wife, why is he so cold toward me... And it's not coldness, for I know he loves me, but something fresh now divides us.

translation.en: Lily has fallen ill, and I'm afraid it's scarlet fever.

translation.en: Here, take this,' she said, turning to Tanya who was drawing off a ring which fitted loosely on her aunt's small tapering finger.

translation.en: 'I will write and let you know what I decide,' said Karenin, rising and holding on by the table.

translation.ru: Ничего веселого и радостного не было в этом чувстве; напротив, это был новый мучительный страх.
translation.en: There was nothing merry or joyful in it; on the contrary, there was a new and distressing sense of fear.

translation.en: Oblonsky went down and himself carefully took the canvas cover off the varnished case, opened it, and set to work to put together his valuable gun, which was of the newest type.

translation.ru: -- Но как же ты обедать с ними будешь?
translation.en: 'But how can you dine with them?

translation.ru: Но дело в том, -- она, ожидая этого развода здесь, в Москве, где все его и ее знают, живет три месяца; никуда не выезжает, никого не видает из женщин, кроме Долли, потому что, понимаешь ли, она не хочет, чтобы к ней ездили из милости; эта дура княжна Варвара -- и та уехала, считая это неприличным.
translation.en: But the point is that she has been living for several weeks in Moscow, where everybody knows her and him, awaiting the divorce, without going out anywhere or seeing any women except Dolly, because, you understand, she does not want people to come and see her as a charity. Even that fool Princess Barbara has left her, considering it improper!

translation.en: And Agatha Mikhaylovna will give us some of that excellent herb brandy...'

translation.en: He ordered his German valet, who had run up from a second-class carriage, to get his luggage and take it home, and he himself went up to her.

translation.ru: -- И все бы поехали туда, если б это было так же принято, как опера, -- подхватила княгиня Мягкая...
translation.en: 'And everybody would go there if it were considered the thing, as the opera is,' put in the Princess Myagkaya.

translation.ru: -- Вот, ей-богу, ни малейшего понятия не имею!-- с громким смехом сказал Катавасов.
translation.en: 'No, I swear I have not the slightest idea!' said Katavasov, laughing loudly.

translation.ru: Вчера только она объявила ему, что она беременна. И он почувствовал, что это известие и то, чего она ждала от него, требовало чего-то такого, что не определено вполне кодексом тех правил, которыми он руководствовался в жизни.
translation.en: Only yesterday she had told him that she was pregnant, and he felt that this news and what she expected of him called for something that was not fully defined by his code of rules.

translation.en: They completed two more swaths and then the old man stopped.

translation.en: Oh, what a crowd of ideas!

translation.en: 'I do not hold you,' he might have said. 'You may go where you please.

translation.ru: Когда он, в тот же вечер, как приехал домой, сообщил приказчику свои планы, приказчик с видимым удовольствием согласился с тою частью речи, которая показывала, что все делаемое до сих пор было вздор и невыгодно.
translation.en: When, on the evening of his return, he informed the steward of his intentions, the steward with evident pleasure agreed with that part of the plan which showed that all that had been done up to then was foolish and unprofitable.

translation.ru: -- Неужели ты думаешь, что он может выздороветь? -- сказал Левин, глядя на постоянно закрывавшийся, как только она вперед проводила гребень, узкий ряд назади ее круглой головки.
translation.en: 'Do you really think he can recover?' he asked, looking at the back of her round little head, at the narrow parting which closed every time she drew the comb forward.

translation.en: No, it's nothing. It's past.'

translation.en: 'I am very sorry you were not there,' she said; 'I don't mean present in the room... I should not have behaved so naturally with you there...

translation.ru: Но Василий Лукич думал только о том, что надо учить урок грамматики для учителя, который придет в два часа.
translation.en: But Vasily Lukich only thought that Serezha must prepare his grammar lesson, as his teacher was coming at two.

translation.ru: Лошадь вязла по ступицу, и каждая нога ее чмокала, вырываясь из полуоттаявшей земли.
translation.en: The horse sank into the ground up to its pasterns and drew each foot out of the half-thawed earth with a smacking noise.

translation.en: Vronsky was satisfied.

translation.ru: Я и говорила!-- радостно подхватила дама. -- И ведь правда, что пожертвовано теперь около миллиона?
translation.en: I said so!' the lady said joyfully. 'And isn't it true that about a million roubles have been collected?'

translation.ru: Да, низкий, гадкий человек!
translation.en: Yes, a mean, horrid man!

translation.en: I'll ride over and see,' said Levin mounting the little light bay horse, Kolpik, which the coachman had brought.

translation.ru: Но прошла неделя, другая, третья, и в обществе не было заметно никакого впечатления; друзья его, специалисты и ученые, иногда, очевидно из учтивости, заговаривали о ней. Остальные же его знакомые, не интересуясь книгой ученого содержания, вовсе не говорили с ним о ней.
translation.en: But a week passed, and another, and a third, and no impression was noticeable in Society. His friends, the specialists and the scholars, sometimes – from politeness – mentioned it; his other acquaintances, not interested in learned works, did not mention it to him at all.

translation.ru: Он был у нас.
translation.en: He called on us.

translation.ru: Камердинер, чувствуя себя невиноватым, хотел оправдываться, но, взглянув на барина, понял по его лицу, что надо только молчать, и, поспешно извиваясь, опустился на ковер и стал разбирать целые и разбитые рюмки и бутылки.
translation.en: The valet, conscious that he was not to blame, was about to defend himself, but, glancing at his master saw by his face that there was nothing for it but to keep silence; so, stooping quickly, he knelt on the carpet and began sorting out the whole and broken glasses and bottles.

translation.ru: -- Главное же, чего он хочет... хочет, чтобы ты не страдала.
translation.en: 'But the chief thing he wants is that you should not suffer.'

translation.ru: Пятно стеарина давало человеку новую позу.
translation.en: A grease spot had given the figure a new pose.

translation.en: No one but the magistrate, when she was tried for an attempt to escape from the house of ill fame, ever spoke to her so politely... Oh heavens, how senseless everything is in this world!' he suddenly exclaimed.

translation.en: 'You have not seen me but I saw you,' said Levin with a beaming smile of joy. 'I saw you on your way to Ergushevo from the station.'

translation.en: She does not understand and I cannot speak out about it to her.

translation.en: While he was washing, Petritsky in a few words described his own position in so far as it had changed since Vronsky went away.

translation.en: Dolly had not had time to rise to go to meet her husband, before Levin had jumped out of the window of the room below, where he had been teaching Grisha, and had lifted the boy out too.

translation.en: 'And do you know, life has less charm when one thinks of death, but it is more peaceful.'

translation.en: Every remark, even the most trivial, which showed that those who judged it saw even but a small part of what he himself saw in it, moved him deeply.

translation.ru: Сергей Иванович, продолжая разговор с хозяйкой и одним ухом слушая брата, покосился на него. "Что это с ним нынче?
translation.en: Koznyshev, while continuing his conversation with the hostess, listened with one ear to his brother, turning his eyes toward him, and thought, 'What has happened to him to-day?

translation.en: The Emperor, the whole Court, and crowds of people were all looking at them – at him and at Makhotin, who was a full length ahead of him when they approached the Devil (as the solid barrier was called).

translation.en: Levin, leaning over the balustrade, looked on and listened.

translation.en: 'Excuse me, your Excellency, for taking the liberty of troubling you!

translation.en: 'No rent?

translation.en: But if you feel that there are any grounds, however slight, I beg you to reflect, and if your heart prompts you to tell me...'

translation.ru: -- Вы имеете такое влияние на Анну, она так любит вас, -- сказал он, -- помогите мне.
translation.en: 'You have so much influence over Anna and she is so fond of you,' he said. 'Help me!'

translation.ru: Дарья Александровна видела, что Анна недовольна была тем тоном игривости, который был между нею и Весловским, но сама невольно впадала в него.
translation.en: Dolly noticed that Anna did not like the playful tone that had arisen between herself and Veslovsky, yet could not help falling in with it.

translation.ru: Всякое слово в разговоре с нею получало особенное значение.
translation.en: Every word of his conversation with her assumed a special importance.

translation.ru: Левин долго не мог спать.
translation.en: Levin could not fall asleep for a long time.

translation.ru: В гостиную входила Анна. Как всегда, держась чрезвычайно прямо, своим быстрым, твердым и легким шагом, отличавшим ее от походки других светских женщин, и не изменяя направления взгляда, она сделала те несколько шагов, которые отделяли ее от хозяйки, пожала ей руку, улыбнулась и с этою улыбкой оглянулась на Вронского.
translation.en: Anna entered the room holding herself, as usual, very erect, and without changing the direction of her eyes approached her hostess, walking with that quick, firm yet light step which distinguished her from other Society women. She shook hands; smilingly, and with the same smile looked round at Vronsky.

translation.ru: Шелковистая с выспевающими семенами трава была почти по пояс на заливном месте.
translation.en: In the meadow, which was flooded every spring, the silky grass, now scattering its seeds, reached almost to his waist.

translation.ru: Так что по тому, как он повел дела, было ясно, что он не расстроил, а увеличил свое состояние.
translation.en: So that from the way he managed his business it was clear that he was not wasting but increasing his property.

translation.ru: Нынче ему особенно ясно представлялось все значение его дела, и само собою складывались в его уме целые периоды, выражающие сущность его мыслей.
translation.en: To-day the importance of his work presented itself to him with especial clearness, and whole paragraphs of their own accord shaped themselves in his mind, expressing the gist of his thoughts.

translation.ru: Потом было личное дело, посещение доктора и управляющего делами.
translation.en: After that came personal matters – a visit from his doctor and one from his steward.

translation.ru: Прежде (это началось почти с детства и все росло до полной возмужалости), когда он старался сделать что-нибудь такое, что сделало бы добро для всех, для человечества, для России, для всей деревни, он замечал, что мысли об этом были приятны, но сама деятельность всегда бывала нескладная, не было полной уверенности в том, что дело необходимо нужно, и сама деятельность, казавшаяся сначала столь большою, все уменьшаясь и уменьшаясь, сходила на нет; теперь же, когда он после женитьбы стал более и более ограничиваться жизнью для себя, он, хотя не испытывал более никакой радости при мысли о своей деятельности, чувствовал уверенность, что дело его необходимо, видел, что оно спорится гораздо лучше, чем прежде, и что оно все становится больше и больше.
translation.en: Formerly (it had been so almost from childhood and increasingly so till his complete maturity) when he tried to do anything for the good of everybody, for humanity, for Russia, for the whole village, he had noticed that the thoughts of it were agreeable, but the activity itself was always unsatisfactory; there was no full assurance that the work was really necessary, and the activity itself, which at first seemed so great, ever lessened and lessened till it vanished. But now since his marriage, when he began to confine himself more and more to living for himself, though he no longer felt any joy at the thought of his activity, he felt confident that his work was necessary, saw that it progressed far better than formerly, and that it was always growing more and more.

translation.ru: Он, очевидно, без малейшего усилия избегал всех разговоров, которые могли бы повести к неловкости.
translation.en: Evidently he avoided, without the least effort, everything in conversation that might have sounded awkward.

translation.ru: Алексей Александрович после встречи у себя на крыльце с Вронским поехал, как и намерен был, в итальянскую оперу.
translation.en: KARENIN AFTER MEETING VRONSKY in his own porch went on as had been his intention to the Italian Opera.

translation.ru: Невозможно! -- говорил он, глядя на измятый перед своей рубашки. -- И что как вещи увезли уже на железную дорогу!-- вскрикнул он с отчаянием.
translation.en: He glanced at his crumpled shirt-front. 'And suppose the things have already gone to the station!' he exclaimed in despair.

translation.en: And she saw them with her far-sighted eyes, she saw them close by, too; when they met in the dance, and the more she saw of them the surer she was that the blow had fallen.

translation.en: The unseen larks burst into song above the velvety fresh green and the frozen stubble, the peewits began to cry above the water brought down by the storm and still flooding the low-lying places and marshes, and high up the cranes and geese flew, uttering their spring call.

translation.en: To their surprise the lovely one stops at the door of the very house they are going to.

translation.en: Every one was talking about the elections and how tired out the Marshal was and how interesting the debates had been. In one group Levin heard them praising his brother.

translation.en: 'That's all very well, but you think only of yourself! The sufferings of the man who was your husband do not interest you. What do you care that his whole life is wrecked and how much he has suf… suf… suffled!'

translation.en: 'Tell me, Constantine Dmitrich,' said Dolly with her kind though slightly ironical smile, 'why are you angry with Kitty?'

translation.en: 'Don't hurt yourself – it needs practice!' Nicholas Shcherbatsky called out.

translation.en: He tried to read but could not awaken in himself the lively interest he had felt for the Eugubine Tables.

translation.en: Karenin took the telegrams and opened them.

translation.en: The lawyer's grey eyes tried not to laugh but they danced with irrepressible glee, and Karenin saw that it was not only the glee of a man getting profitable business; there was triumph and delight, and a gleam resembling the evil-boding gleam he had seen in his wife's eyes.

translation.en: 'Home,' replied Vronsky. 'To tell you the truth I felt in such a pleasant mood when I left the Shcherbatskys' that I did not care to go anywhere else.'

translation.en: Anna had heard nothing about the Statute, and felt ashamed that she had so lightly forgotten what was of such importance to him.

translation.en: 'How funny you are!' said Dolly, regarding Levin's agitation with a sad yet mocking smile. 'Yes, I understand it more and more,' she added meditatively. 'Then you won't come to see us while Kitty is here?'

translation.en: 'Couldn't one ask him to paint Anna Arkadyevna's portrait?' said Vronsky.

translation.ru: У ней была своя странная религия метемпсихозы, в которую она твердо верила, мало заботясь о догматах церкви.
translation.en: She had a strange religion of her own, firmly believing in the transmigration of souls, and not caring about Church dogmas.

translation.ru: Разве возможно было думать, чтобы в ее положении ехать в абонемент Патти, где будет весь ей знакомый свет?
translation.en: Was it conceivable that, in her position, she was going to the opera when Patti was to sing, and when all the subscribers, her Society acquaintances, would be present?

translation.ru: XXI
translation.en: CHAPTER XXI

translation.ru: -- Петр Дмитрич, Петр Дмитрич! -- умоляющим голосом заговорил он в отворенную дверь. -- Ради бога, простите меня.
translation.en: 'Peter Dmitrich! Peter Dmitrich!' he called out in a tone of entreaty through the open door.

translation.ru: Они знали его щедрость, и чрез полчаса больной гамбургский доктор, живший наверху, с завистью смотрел в окно на эту веселую русскую компанию здоровых людей, собравшуюся под каштаном.
translation.en: They knew his generosity, and in a quarter of an hour the sick Hamburg doctor, who lived upstairs, was looking with envy from his window at the merry party of healthy Russians gathered under the chestnut tree.

translation.ru: Как же вы будете отвечать ему?
translation.en: How will you answer him?

translation.en: Peter jumped up on the box, and with his arm akimbo told the coachman to drive to the station.

translation.ru: Вместо того чтоб оскорбиться, отрекаться, оправдываться, просить прощения, оставаться даже равнодушным -- все было бы лучше того, что он сделал! -- его лицо совершенно невольно ("рефлексы головного мозга", -- подумал Степан Аркадьич, который любил физиологию), совершенно невольно вдруг улыбнулось привычною, доброю и потому глупою улыбкой.
translation.en: Instead of taking offence, denying, making excuses, asking forgiveness, or even remaining indifferent (anything would have been better than what he did), he involuntarily ('reflex action of the brain,' thought Oblonsky, who was fond of physiology) smiled his usual kindly and therefore silly smile.

translation.ru: -- Нет, у моего отца были; но я помню и знаю.
translation.en: 'No; my father did, and I remember them and know something about them.'

translation.ru: В смерть, про которую ему так часто говорили, Сережа не верил совершенно.
translation.en: He did not in the least believe in death, which was so often mentioned to him.

translation.ru: Не подходи к окну, -- сказала Анна, пробуя, высохла ли краска. -- Алексей, краска уже высохла, -- прибавила она.
translation.en: Don't go near the window!' said Anna, feeling whether the paint was dry. 'Alexis, the paint is dry already,' she added.

translation.ru: Все засмеялись, и в особенности весело Степан Аркадьич.
translation.en: Everybody laughed, and Oblonsky most merrily of all.

translation.ru: Она вернулась в свой угол и села.
translation.en: She went back to her corner and sat down.

translation.ru: Левин чувствовал, что брат Николай в душе своей, в самой основе своей души, несмотря на все безобразие своей жизни, не был более неправ, чем те люди, которые презирали его.
translation.en: Levin felt that his brother Nicholas, in his soul, in the innermost depths of his soul, despite the depravity of his life, was no worse than those who despised him.

translation.ru: Ему захотелось есть и спать.
translation.en: He wished to eat and sleep.

translation.ru: Но Левин был влюблен, и поэтому ему казалось, что Кити была такое совершенство во всех отношениях, такое существо превыше всего земного, а он такое земное низменное существо, что не могло быть и мысли о том, чтобы другие и она сама признали его достойным ее.
translation.en: But Levin was in love, and therefore Kitty seemed to him so perfect in every respect, so transcending everything earthly, and he seemed to himself so very earthly and insignificant a creature, that the possibility of his being considered worthy of her by others or by herself was to him unimaginable.

translation.ru: -- Я никогда не выйду.
translation.en: 'I shall never marry.'

translation.ru: "Но что он?"
translation.en: 'But what of him?'

translation.en: And Steve says he can't go to see Alexis Alexandrovich; and I can't write again.

translation.ru: Ведь вы не поступили дурно?
translation.en: You did not do anything wrong?'

translation.ru: -- Князь Александр Щербацкий, -- сказала мадам Шталь, поднимая на него свои небесные глаза, в которых Кити заметила неудовольствие. -- Очень рада.
translation.en: 'Prince Alexander Shcherbatsky,' said Madame Stahl, lifting toward him her heavenly eyes, in which Kitty detected displeasure. 'I am very pleased.

translation.ru: Она спросила его о скачках.
translation.en: She inquired about the races.

translation.ru: Большой дом со старою семейною мебелью; не щеголеватые, грязноватые, но почтительные старые лакеи, очевидно еще из прежних крепостных, не переменившие хозяина; толстая, добродушная жена в чепчике с кружевами и турецкой шали, ласкавшая хорошенькую внучку, дочь дочери; молодчик сын, гимназист шестого класса, приехавший из гимназии и, здороваясь с отцом, поцеловавший его большую руку; внушительные ласковые речи и жесты хозяина -- все это вчера возбудило в Левине невольное уважение и сочувствие.
translation.en: The large house with the old family furniture; the old footmen by no means smart, rather shabby, but respectful – evidently former serfs who had remained with their master; the stout, good-natured wife, in a lace cap and Turkish shawl, caressing her pretty granddaughter (a daughter's daughter), the manly young son in the sixth form of the High School, who had just come home and who kissed his father's large hand in greeting; the impressive kindly words and gestures of the host – all this had yesterday awakened Levin's involuntary respect and sympathy.

translation.ru: И это-то на минуту, когда Кити напомнила о деньгах, расстроило его;но ему некогда было думать об этом.
translation.en: It was this that had upset him for a moment when Kitty reminded him about money; however, he had no time to think about it.

translation.ru: Но, как ни были ей приятны и веселы одни и те же разговоры, -- "Алины-Надины", как называл эти разговоры между сестрами старый князь, -- она знала, что ему должно быть это скучно.
translation.en: But, agreeable and amusing as the same oft-repeated conversations might be to her – talks about 'Alines and Nadines,' as the old Prince called those talks between the sisters – she knew they must bore him.

translation.ru: Левин слушал молча, и, несмотря на все усилия, которые он делал над собой, он никак не мог перенестись в душу своего приятеля и понять его чувства и прелести изучения таких женщин.
translation.en: Levin listened in silence, but in spite of all his efforts he could not enter into his friend's soul and understand his feeling, nor the delight of studying women of that kind.

translation.ru: А Василия Лукича ты не видала?
translation.en: You have not seen Vasily Lukich?

translation.ru: Князь разложил подле себя свои покупки, резные сундучки, бирюльки, разрезные ножики всех сортов, которых он накупил кучу на всех водах, и раздаривал их всем, в том числе Лисхен, служанке, и хозяину, с которым он шутил на своем комическом дурном немецком языке, уверяя его, что не воды вылечили Кити, но его отличные кушанья, в особенности суп с черносливом.
translation.en: He spread out his purchases before him: carved caskets, spillikins and paper-knives of all kinds, of which he had bought quantities at all the different watering-places, and he gave them away to everybody, including Lischen, the maid, and the landlord, with whom he joked in his funny broken German, assuring him that not the waters had cured Kitty but his excellent food, especially his plum soup.

translation.ru: Она очень интересна.
translation.en: She is most interesting.'

translation.ru: "Бестолковая!" -- сказал он себе, сел за стол и, раскрыв папку, тотчас с особенным жаром принялся за начатый рисунок.
translation.en: 'What a duffer!' he muttered to himself as he seated himself at the table, and having opened a portfolio he at once set to work with particular ardour at an unfinished drawing.

translation.ru: Я и сам не люблю дурно делать и другим не велю.
translation.en: I don't like to do things badly myself and I see that others don't.

translation.ru: Он по нескольку раз в день ходил в детскую и подолгу сиживал там, так что кормилица и няня, сперва робевшие пред ним, привыкли к нему.
translation.en: Several times a day he went to the nursery, and remained there so long that the nurses, who had been shy in his presence, became quite used to him.

translation.ru: Алексей Александрович начал говорить смело, но, когда он ясно понял то, о чем он говорит, страх, который она испытывала, сообщился ему.
translation.en: Karenin had begun to speak boldly but when he realized clearly what he was talking about the fear she was experiencing communicated itself to him.

translation.ru: Как всегда кажется, что зашибаешь, как нарочно, именно больное место, так и теперь Степан Аркадьич чувствовал, что на беду нынче каждую минуту разговор нападал на больное место Алексея Александровича.
translation.en: As one always seems to knock a sore place, so that day Oblonsky felt that unfortunately the conversation kept striking Karenin's sore place.

translation.ru: Но потом княгиня заметила, что в дочери, независимо от этого очарования, совершается какой-то серьезный душевный переворот.
translation.en: But afterwards the Princess also noticed that, apart from this infatuation, a serious spiritual change was taking place in her daughter.

translation.ru: Ils ont ete charmants.
translation.en: Ils ont été charmants! [They were charming.]

translation.ru: Он хотел подойти к своей лошади, но его опять задержал знакомый.
translation.en: He wished to go up to his own horse, but was again stopped by an acquaintance.

translation.ru: -- Сергей Иваныч?
translation.en: 'Sergius Ivanich?

translation.ru: "Экая досада, -- думал Левин, со вздохом снимая одну перчатку и расправляя шляпу. -- Ну, зачем я иду? ну, что мне с ними говорить?"
translation.en: 'What a nuisance!' thought Levin with a sigh, as he pulled off one glove and smoothed his hat. 'What is the good of my going in? And what on earth am I to say to them?'

translation.ru: И наравне с этими воспоминаниями стояли теперь отказ и то жалкое положение, в котором он должен был представляться другим в этот вечер.
translation.en: And among these recollections stood the memory of her refusal and the pitiful role he must have played in the eyes of the others that evening.

translation.ru: Свияжский оценивал все, как человек, знающий все новые усовершенствования.
translation.en: Sviyazhsky appreciated everything like one who is acquainted with all the newest improvements.

translation.ru: -- Ах, я давно так не смеялась!-- сказала Варенька, собирая зонтик и мешочек. -- Какой он милый, ваш папа!
translation.en: 'Oh dear, I have not laughed so much for a long time!' said Varenka, collecting her sunshade and bag. 'What a dear your Papa is!'

translation.ru: И что ж, чем же я поддержу его любовь?
translation.en: Well, how am I to keep his love?

translation.ru: Левин сел на лошадь и, с сожалением простившись с мужиками, поехал домой.
translation.en: Levin, having regretfully taken leave of them, mounted and rode home.

translation.ru: Алексей Александрович взял руки Вронского и отвел их от лица, ужасного по выражению страдания и стыда, которые были на нем.
translation.en: Karenin took Vronsky's hands and moved them away from his face, terrible with its look of suffering and shame.

translation.ru: "Боже мой, что я сделал!
translation.en: 'My God! What have I done?

translation.ru: Я не могу ревновать и верить, чтоб...
translation.en: I cannot be jealous nor believe that...

translation.ru: "Ну, что же, надо же ему как-нибудь говорить с хозяйкой дома", -- сказал себе Левин.
translation.en: 'Well, what of it? He must say something to the mistress of the house,' Levin told himself.

translation.ru: -- Мы вас ждали вчера, княжна, -- сказал он Кити.
translation.en: 'We were expecting you yesterday, Princess,' he said to Kitty.

translation.ru: А тебя за что?
translation.en: But why should I make you wretched?

translation.ru: -- Да отчего же?
translation.en: 'But why not?'

translation.ru: Иногда, когда мокрота душила его, он с досадой выговаривал: "А! черт!"
translation.en: Sometimes, when the phlegm choked him, he muttered angrily, 'Oh, the devil!'

translation.ru: Он пригляделся и увидел еще другую и третью.
translation.en: He looked close and saw another and a third.

translation.ru: Потом показал одну за другою палаты, кладовую, комнату для белья, потом печи нового устройства, потом тачки такие, которые не будут производить шума, подвозя по коридору нужные вещи, и много другого.
translation.en: Then he took them to one ward after another: to the store-room, the linen-room, showed the stoves built on a new plan, then some silent trolleys to convey necessary articles, and much besides.

translation.ru: -- Говорю, тут и есть. Как выедешь... -- говорил он, перебирая рукой по крылу коляски.
translation.en: 'I tell you it's just there, where you come out,' and he went on rubbing his hand along the mud-guard of the calèche.

translation.ru: Но товарищи тотчас же поняли, что он не туда только едет.
translation.en: But his friends understood at once that it was not only there that he was going.

translation.ru: Только одна Кити не могла дослушать его, -- ее позвали мыть Митю.
translation.en: Only Kitty could not hear him to the end, she was called away to bath Mitya.

translation.ru: Она не хотела борьбы, упрекала его за то, что он хотел бороться, но невольно сама становилась в положение борьбы.
translation.en: She did not want strife and blamed him for wanting to fight, but yet she involuntarily took up a fighting attitude.

translation.ru: -- Да еще как!
translation.en: 'Yes, I should think so!

translation.ru: Помочь нельзя.
translation.en: You had better not go.

translation.ru: Они погубили свои карьеры из-за женщин.
translation.en: They have ruined their careers because of women.'

translation.ru: -- Так вы думаете, что я говорю неправду? И она невесело засмеялась.
translation.en: 'Then you think I am not telling the truth?' and she laughed mirthlessly.

translation.ru: Анна теперь уж не смущалась.
translation.en: Anna was now no longer embarrassed.

translation.ru: Все громко выражали свое неодобрение, все повторяли сказанную кем-то фразу: "Недостает только цирка с львами", и ужас чувствовался всеми, так что, когда Вронский упал и Анна громко ахнула, в этом не было ничего необыкновенного.
translation.en: EVERYONE WAS LOUDLY EXPRESSING DISAPPROVAL and repeating the words some one had uttered: 'They will have gladiators and lions next,' and every one was feeling the horror of it, so that when Vronsky fell and Anna gave a loud exclamation, there was nothing remarkable about it.

translation.ru: -- А правда, что Власьева меньшая выходит за Топова?
translation.en: 'And is it true that the younger Vlasyeva is going to be married to Topov.'

translation.ru: -- А признайтесь, есть это чувство, как у гоголевского жениха, что в окошко хочется выпрыгнуть?
translation.en: 'Now confess that you feel like the bridegroom in Gogol's play who jumped out of the window?' teased Chirikov.

translation.ru: -- Давайте сейчас попробуем, графиня, -- начал он, но Левин хотел досказать то, что он думал.
translation.en: 'Let us try now, Countess,' he began, but Levin wanted to finish saying what he thought.

translation.ru: -- Да, это очень дурно, -- сказала Анна и, взяв сына за плечо, не строгим, а робким взглядом, смутившим и обрадовавшим мальчика, посмотрела на него и поцеловала. -- Оставьте его со мной, -- сказала она удивленной гувернантке и, не выпуская руки сына, села за приготовленный с кофеем стол.
translation.en: 'Yes, that was very wrong,' said Anna, and putting her hand on his shoulder she looked at him not with a severe but with a timid expression which confused and gladdened the boy. She kissed him. 'Leave him to me,' she said to the astonished governess and still holding his hand she sat down at the breakfast table.

translation.ru: Я очень рада, что он меня терпеть не может, -- говорила она о нем.
translation.en: I am very glad he hates me,' she used to say with reference to him.

translation.ru: Вронский вошел в вагон.
translation.en: Vronsky entered the carriage.

translation.ru: -- Так так и мы, -- сказал Левин. -- Очень, очень приятно было встретиться, -- прибавил он, увидав подходившего к нему Свияжского.
translation.en: 'Just like us,' said Levin. 'Very, very glad to have met you,' he added, seeing Sviyazhsky approaching.

translation.ru: Когда партия кончилась, Степан Аркадьич взял Левина под руку.
translation.en: When they had finished their play Oblonsky took Levin's arm.

translation.ru: XXXI
translation.en: CHAPTER XXXI

translation.ru: Молодая баба работала легко, весело и ловко.
translation.en: The young woman was working with ease, cheerfulness and skill.

translation.ru: Наконец дверь с грохотом отворилась, вылетел, кружась и повертываясь на воздухе, Крак, половопегий пойнтер Степана Аркадьича, и вышел сам Степан Аркадьич с ружьем в руках и с сигарой во рту.
translation.en: At length the door opened noisily and out bounded, spinning round and round in the air, Krak, Oblonsky's yellow spotted pointer, followed by Oblonsky himself with a gun in his hand and a cigar in his mouth.

translation.ru: -- Почему ты думаешь? -- сказал Левин, чтобы сказать что-нибудь.
translation.en: 'Why do you think that?' asked Levin, in order to say something.

translation.ru: Видишь -- запирается, оттого не споро.
translation.en: Don't you see, it gets jammed and that's why it does not go well!

translation.ru: Он сел опять, ожидая приезда гостей, чтоб уехать незаметно.
translation.en: He too sat down until the arrival of other guests should enable him to get away unnoticed.

translation.ru: Она взглянула на него.
translation.en: She looked up at him.

translation.ru: -- Приехали! -- Вот он! -- Который? -- Помоложе-то, что ль? -- а она-то, матушка, ни жива ни мертва!-- заговорили в толпе, когда Левин, встретив невесту у подъезда, с нею вместе вошел в церковь.
translation.en: 'HERE THEY ARE! There he is! Which one? Is it the younger one? And look at her, poor dear! More dead than alive!' people in the crowd were saying as Levin met his bride at the door and entered the church with her.

translation.ru: -- Хорош!-- смеясь, сказал Степан Аркадьич, -- а меня же называешь нигилистом!
translation.en: 'You are a good one!' remarked Oblonsky, laughing. 'And you call me a Nihilist!

translation.ru: VIII
translation.en: CHAPTER VIII

translation.ru: Разумеется, есть выражение чиновника в Пилате и жалости в Христе, так как один олицетворение плотской, другой -- духовной жизни.
translation.en: Of course there was an official expression in Pilate's face and pity in Christ's, for the former was the embodiment of carnal and the latter of spiritual life.

translation.ru: Ей захотелось посмотреть на его карточку и поговорить о нем.
translation.en: She longed to look at his portrait and to talk about him.

translation.ru: Он не вспоминал теперь, как бывало прежде, всего хода мысли (этого не нужно было ему).
translation.en: He did not now recall, as he had done before, the whole course of his thoughts (he did not now need to).

translation.ru: В те несколько секунд, во время которых посетители молча смотрели на картину, Михайлов тоже смотрел на нее, и смотрел равнодушным, посторонним глазом.
translation.en: During the few moments that they were silently gazing at it, Mikhaylov also regarded it with the indifferent eye of a stranger.

translation.ru: Кто-то, нагнувшись, поправил шлейф невесты.
translation.en: Some one stooped down to arrange the bride's veil.

translation.ru: Из середины и извне круга все теснились к столбу, и кавалергардская группа солдат и офицеров громкими возгласами выражала радость ожидаемого торжества своего офицера и товарища.
translation.en: From within and without the ring every one was crowding toward the winning-post, and a group of horse-guards, – officers and men, – with loud shouts were expressing their joy at the expected triumph of their officer and comrade.

translation.ru: Потому ли, что дети непостоянны или очень чутки и почувствовали, что Анна в этот день совсем не такая, как в тот, когда они так полюбили ее, что она уже не занята ими, -- но только они вдруг прекратили свою игру с тетей и любовь к ней, и их совершенно не занимало то, что она уезжает.
translation.en: Whether it is that children are inconstant or that they are sensitive and felt that Anna was not the same person to-day as she had been that other day when they had been so fond of her, and that she no longer took any interest in them, at any rate they suddenly left off playing with their aunt and loving her, and were not at all concerned about her leaving.

translation.ru: Теперь, когда он связался с Лидией Ивановной и с Landau, все говорят, что он полоумный, и я бы и рада не соглашаться со всеми, но на этот раз не могу.
translation.en: Now that he has got so chummy with Lydia Ivanovna and Landau, every one says he is half-witted; and I should be glad not to agree with everybody, but this time I can't help it.'

translation.ru: Разговор зашел о том, как Тушкевич с Весловским одни ездили в лодке, и Тушкевич стал рассказывать про последние гонки в Петербурге в Яхт-клубе.
translation.en: Reference was made to Tushkevich and Veslovsky having been for a row by themselves, and Tushkevich began to tell about the last boat races at the Petersburg Yacht Club.

translation.ru: Я бы выпил, -- не без хитрости сказал Левин, надеясь, что Весловский соблазнится водкой и уйдет к ним.
translation.en: I should go and have a drink,' said Levin, not quite disinterestedly, hoping that the vodka would tempt Veslovsky and lure him away.

translation.ru: Несмотря на мрачность окружающей природы, он чувствовал себя особенно возбужденным.
translation.en: Notwithstanding the gloomy aspect of nature around him he felt peculiarly elated.

translation.ru: И ни одной минуты нельзя было оставить его одного.
translation.en: One could not leave him a moment alone.

translation.ru: В соборе Левин, вместе с другими поднимая руку и повторяя слова протопопа, клялся самыми страшными клятвами исполнять все то, на что надеялся губернатор.
translation.en: In the cathedral Levin, with the others, raised his hand, repeating the words of the priest, and swore by the most awful oaths to fulfil all the things the Governor had hoped for.

translation.ru: Он слышал только ее слова и придавал им только тот прямой смысл, который они имели.
translation.en: He only heard her words, and gave them only their direct meaning.

translation.ru: Алексей Александрович загородил ее собою, давая ей время оправиться.
translation.en: He stepped forward so as to screen her, giving her time to recover.

translation.ru: Молодой Щербацкий, с которым не познакомили Каренина, старался показать, что это нисколько его не стесняет.
translation.en: Young Shcherbatsky, who had not been introduced to Karenin, tried to look as if this did not make him feel at all awkward.

translation.ru: Катавасов, давно собиравшийся исполнить данное Левину обещание побывать у него, поехал с ним вместе.
translation.en: Katavasov, who had promised Levin to visit him, and had long been meaning to keep that promise, accompanied Koznyshev.

translation.ru: Левин подошел к Катавасову.
translation.en: Levin joined Katavasov.

translation.ru: Где вы остановились?
translation.en: Where are you staying?

translation.ru: Профессор с досадой и как будто умственною болью от перерыва оглянулся на странного вопрошателя, похожего более на бурлака, чем на философа, и перенес глаза на Сергея Ивановича, как бы спрашивая: что ж тут говорить?
translation.en: The professor, vexed and apparently mentally hurt by the interruption, turned to look at this strange questioner who resembled a barge-hauler rather than a philosopher, and then looked at Koznyshev, as if asking, 'What can one say to this?'

translation.ru: XXII
translation.en: CHAPTER XXII

translation.ru: Это уж будет слишком глупо.
translation.en: That would be too stupid!

translation.ru: Действительно, она не то что угадала (связь ее с ребенком не была еще порвана), она верно узнала по приливу молока у себя недостаток пищи у него.
translation.en: It was not a mere guess – the bond between herself and the baby had not yet been severed – and she knew surely by the flow of milk within herself that he was wanting food.

translation.ru: Денег нет ничего.
translation.en: He had no money at all.

translation.ru: Левин уже устал от напряжения мысли. Он чувствовал, что, несмотря на все напряжение мысли, он не мог понять то, что было так.
translation.en: He felt that despite all his mental efforts he could not understand what was 'so' and was already lagging far behind his dying brother.

translation.ru: Только что успели уничтожить откупа, как явились железные дороги, банки: тоже нажива без труда.
translation.en: Hardly were the monopolies stopped before railways and banks appeared: other means of acquiring wealth without work.'

translation.ru: Ну, и слава богу, что с ним все кончено".
translation.en: Well, thank heaven that all is over with him!'

translation.ru: Как вот этак сделаю, он так и просияет, голубчик.
translation.en: When I do like that, he quite brightens up, the dear!

translation.ru: Уездные предводители заходили с тарелочками, в которых были шары, от своих столов к губернскому, и начались выборы.
translation.en: The District Marshals carried little plates filled with ballot balls from their own tables to the Provincial table, and the election began.

translation.ru: Она прежде всего женщина с сердцем, ты вот увидишь.
translation.en: She is first of all a woman with a heart, you'll see!

translation.ru: Некоторые из молодых, по наблюдениям Левина, принадлежали к старой партии, и некоторые, напротив, самые старые дворяне шептались со Свияжским и, очевидно, были горячими сторонниками новой партии.
translation.en: Some of the young ones, as Levin observed, belonged to the old party, and on the other hand some very aged noblemen conversed in whispers with Sviyazhsky and evidently were warm partisans of the new party.

translation.ru: Когда поезд подошел к станции, Анна вышла в толпе других пассажиров и, как от прокаженных, сторонясь от них, остановилась на платформе, стараясь вспомнить, зачем она сюда приехала и что намерена была делать.
translation.en: When the train stopped at the station, Anna got out with the crowd of passengers, and shunning them as if they were lepers, stopped on the platform trying to remember why she had come there and what she had intended to do.

translation.ru: Петрицкий вдруг вскочил на коленки и оглянулся.
translation.en: Petritsky suddenly sprang to his knees and looked round.

translation.ru: "Если можно меня простить, то простите, -- сказал ее взгляд, -- я так счастлива".
translation.en: 'If you can forgive me, please do,' pleaded her look. 'I am so happy.'

translation.ru: -- Сомнения свойственны слабости человеческой, но мы должны молиться, чтобы милосердый господь укрепил нас.
translation.en: 'Doubts are natural to human weakness, but we must pray that our merciful Lord will strengthen us.

translation.ru: -- Этот сыр недурен. Прикажете? -- говорил хозяин. -- Неужели ты опять был на гимнастике? -- обратился он к Левину, левою рукой ощупывая его мышцу, Левин улыбнулся, напружил руку, и под пальцами Степана Аркадьича, как круглый сыр, поднялся стальной бугор из-под тонкого сукна сюртука.
translation.en: 'Have you really been doing gymnastics again?' he went on turning to Levin, and with his left hand he felt Levin's muscles. Levin smiled, tightening his arm, and under Oblonsky's fingers a lump like a Dutch cheese and hard as steel bulged out beneath the fine cloth of Levin's coat.

translation.ru: -- Да, -- подтвердил он, -- и княгиня Тверская совершенно неуместно вмешивается в самые трудные семейные дела.

translation.en: When he had changed the first hundred-rouble note to buy liveries for the footman and hall porter, he had involuntarily calculated that those useless liveries – which, however, were absolutely necessary, judging by the surprise of the old Princess and Kitty at his hint that one could do without liveries – would cost as much as the hire of two labourers for the summer months, that is, of one for about three hundred working days between Easter and Advent – and each a day of heavy labour from early morning till late in the evening.
